medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 34-year-old male, was initially diagnosed with primary hyperparathyroidism due to elevated serum PTH levels. Later findings revealed familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia (FHH). No specific duration of the symptoms was mentioned.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The proband had elevated serum PTH levels and was vitamin D deficient (8.8 nmol/liter). The proband’s mother also had elevated calcium and mildly elevated serum PTH.
medical_history.family_history: The proband’s mother was hypercalcemic with mildly elevated serum PTH levels and his baby daughter presented with neonatal hyperparathyroidism.
